column4: hi, i need help with chroot.. I accidentally deleted all kernels from my ubuntu and I'm now trying to reinstall one by using chroot from live-cd. However when I run apt-get it says: "error while loading shared libraries: libapt-pkg-libc6.10-6.so.4.8 can not ope shared object file: No such file or directory." Both the live-cd and the install are kubuntu maverick 64bit
the kernels.. I wanted to delete mz old kernels and used a bad command
what was the command to delete old kernel?
apt-get remove 2.6.33* it will remove 2.6.35 too
i mean you can't just purge 2.6.*
well apparently you can.. cause that's what happened. I did not delete 2.6 I wanted to delete 2.6.33* and realised too late that the expression 2.6.33 also matches 2.6.35
expression you just gave is wont do anything like that
theres package linux-generic it's just docs
erUSUL  that's from the live-cd pastebin.com/KvhbGzA8 that's the command I used. check what they want to remove.
erUSUL  correct link http://pastebin.com/KvhbGzA8 It wasn't the behaviour i expected either otherwise i wouldn't have pressed yes
you dont make sense stop it
run the command on your own pc and check for yourself.. it's not rocketscience.. just copy it
i got it that very bad idea to hit Y when not understanding the consecuences
